title: OpenAI announces ChatGPT parental controls following family's lawsuit - ABC News
description: The company says it plans to roll out the new features within the next 120 days.
content: Family OpenAI announces ChatGPT parental controls following family's lawsuit The company says it plans to roll out the new features within the next 120 days. By Yi-Jin Yu September 2, 2025, 3:49 PM OpenAI says it is launching parental controls for ChatGPT in the coming months. In its latest update announcement Tuesday, OpenAI, the company that developed ChatGPT, said parents will be able to link their ChatGPT accounts with their teens' ChatGPT accounts and control how the generative AI chatbot would respond to their kids' queries and prompts -- including with "age-appropriate model behavior rules" -- as well as disable features and set up notifications specifically for when their child "is in a moment of acute distress." Parents sue ChatGPT over son's suicide The news comes after a California family sued OpenAI in August, alleging ChatGPT played a role in their 16-year-old son's death by suicide. Close-up view of the OpenAI logo on its website. Adobe Stock OpenAI said this week that its staffers will continue to partner with experts, such as psychiatrists and pediatricians, to improve the ChatGPT tool and set up models to continue to "recognize and respond to signs of mental and emotional distress." ChatGPT responds to lawsuits "We are adding even more clinicians and researchers to our network, including those with deep expertise in areas like eating disorders, substance use, and adolescent health," the company added in its announcement.
